trans-unit.source: Provides a collection container that enables ASP.NET server controls to maintain a list of their child controls.
You can access any of the properties and methods of the ControlCollection class through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Since the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class is the base class for all ASP.NET server controls, all server controls inherit this property.
For more information about collections, see [Collections and Data Structures](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> class for the specified parent server control.
The ASP.NET server control that the control collection is created for.
Occurs if the owner parameter is .
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object to the collection.
The new control is added to the end of an ordinal index array.
The control can be an instance of any ASP.NET server control, a custom server control you create, or a literal control.
To add a control to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> to add to the collection.
Thrown if the child parameter does not specify a control.
Thrown if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object to the collection at the specified index location.
The added control can be an instance of any ASP.NET server control, a custom server control you create, or a literal control.
The location in the array at which to add the child control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> to add to the collection.
The child parameter does not specify a control.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Removes all controls from the current server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.

Use this method to empty a custom control's <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> when you override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.CreateChildControls%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> methods.
Do this when you develop composite, templated controls or templated data-bound controls.
Determines whether the specified server control is in the parent server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
The server control to search for in the collection.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified server control exists in the collection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Copies the child controls stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object to an <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, beginning at the specified index location in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> to copy the child controls to.
The zero-based relative index in `array` where copying begins.
array is not and not one-dimensional.
Gets the number of server controls in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object for the specified ASP.NET server control.
The number of server controls in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref>.
Retrieves an enumerator that can iterate through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
The enumerator to iterate through the collection.
Retrieves the index of a specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object in the collection.
Use this method to determine the index location of the specified server control in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> for which the index is returned.
The index of the specified server control.
If the server control is not currently a member of the collection, it returns -1.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object is read-only.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object is synchronized.
This property is always <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a reference to the server control at the specified index location in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
The location of the server control in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref>.
The reference to the control.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Gets the ASP.NET server control to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object belongs.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> belongs.
Removes the specified server control from the parent server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
To remove a control from an index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
The server control to be removed.
Removes a child control, at the specified index location, from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
To remove a control from the collection based on its value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The ordinal index of the server control to be removed from the collection.
Thrown if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The <xref:System.Object> used to synchronize the collection.
